meanings.definition: A person who adds decorative red lettering or designs to manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: The talented rubricators carefully added intricate designs to the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: The rubricators were known for their skill in enhancing manuscripts with beautiful red lettering.
meanings.sent3: The rubricators decided to have a competition to see who could create the most elaborate design on the manuscript.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic touch as a rubricator transformed the plain manuscript into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The rubricators' work brought life to the dull pages of the manuscript.

meanings.definition: The act of adding decorative red lettering or designs to manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: The rubricators' task was to enhance the manuscript with vibrant red lettering.
meanings.sent2: During medieval times, rubricators played a crucial role in making manuscripts visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: The rubricators' job seemed easy at first, but it required great attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: The rubricators' work was like adding a touch of magic to the plain manuscript.
meanings.sent5: The rubricators' precise strokes brought out the beauty of the manuscript.
